data.title: Overview of stomach diseases: Types, symptoms and treatments
data.meta_description: Here are some short and simple summaries of stomach diseases, their symptoms, classification, and treatments that you shouldn’t miss.
data.text:
Stomach diseases represent the infections or disorders that attack the digestive process. In this article, we will learn an overview of these gastrointestinal, including common symptoms, cures and some examination and treatment facilities. Don't miss out this helpful information!

Definition of stomach diseases

Stomach diseases happen when the process of digestion is affected by infections or disorders. They can break the normal function of any part in the stomach, such as the lining, cells, muscles, or nerves.

The causes of stomach diseases are numerous, among which the most common ones could be infection, inflammation, illness, or an underlying condition. It is reported that nearly 10% of the world’s population face stomach health problems.

Types of stomach diseases

Among many kinds of stomach diseases, the most common ones are gastritis, Helicobacter pylori infection, stomach ulcers, gastroesophageal reflux and gastric cancer.

While some issues can only cause discomfort to your body for a short time, chronic or severe stomach problems, such as stomach ulcers and gastric cancer can affect your life-quality seriously, or even be life-threatening.

Signs and symptoms of stomach diseases

Below are some typical GI symptoms of stomach health problems. While some of them may be short-term and can go away without any help, others may require proper care or medical treatment.

Abdominal cramping

Abdominal pain

Burning sensation

Bloating or feeling full

Constipation or diarrhea

Indigestion

Loss of appetite

Stomach discomfort

Gastric distress

Nausea/vomiting

Blood in stool

Vomiting blood

Gastritis, stomach ulcers and other conditions may vary from person to another. However, all of these health problems share common symptoms of feeling uncomfortable. For example, gastritis can cause bad breath, belching, bloating, indigestion, and abdominal pain. On the other hand, stomach ulcers may cause weight loss, hunger pains, vomiting, nausea or black stools.

Among the stomach diseases list, stomach cancer is considered one of the most dangerous ones, mostly because the symptoms are often not detected early. If possible, you must stay alert if you have experienced the following signs for more than 2 weeks: uncontrollable weight loss, tiredness, severe belly pain, vomiting blood and having black, sticky stools.

Are stomach diseases curable?

Most of the stomach diseases can be cured with proper treatment and healthcare. Even a fatal disease like stomach cancer can be cured completely if it is detected at an early stage.

Each specific disease will have its own treatment approach. However, the general principles in treating stomach health problems include: using medicines and following a healthy lifestyle.

For example, if you have acute gastritis, normally you won’t have to seek any gastrointestinal therapy, as the immune system will soon clear these infections. As long as you have healthier habits, such as reducing alcohol consumption, eating more fruits and vegetables and getting more sleep, the disease will not be a concern.

Chronic gastritis, however, doesn’t go away on its own. Instead, the issue can improve when you take medical treatment, but the healing process may take longer.

For stomach cancer, the cure rate depends on the stage of the disease. In the early stage, there is a very high chance that you will recover after some surgery, chemotherapy and radiation therapy. If the gastrointestinal cancer has reached advanced stages, most treatments only aim to prolong the patient’s life.

Therefore, it's important that you go see a doctor as soon as you notice any unusual symptoms related to the stomach mentioned above, so that the disease can be identified and the most effective treatment can be sought.
